= names =

 field: stringlist '''.names''' (Read/Write)

== Description ==
The '''names''' field provides access to the complete list of names and keywords that identify a unit.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| Read || stringlist || Returns list of all names for the unit
|-
| Write || stringlist || Can modify the names list (add/remove names)
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* UNIT_ST_PC (Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_NPC (Non-Player Character)
* UNIT_ST_OBJ (Object)
* UNIT_ST_ROOM (Room)
* extraptr (Extra description pointer)

== Examples ==
 dilbegin check_item_names(item : unitptr);
 var
    item_names : stringlist;
 code
 {
    item_names := item.names;
    exec("say This item has " + itoa(length(item_names)) + " names.", self);
    exec("say Primary name: " + item_names.[0], self);
 } dilend

 dilbegin find_by_keyword(target : unitptr);
 var
    all_names : stringlist;
 code
 {
    all_names := target.names;
    if ("sword" in all_names)
    {
       exec("say This is a sword-type weapon.", self);
    }
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The '''names''' field provides read/write access to the complete name list
* The first name in the list (index 0) is typically the primary name used by [[name]] field
* Names can be accessed by index using array notation: `unit.names.[index]`
* Common uses include:
** Multiple aliases for NPCs and objects
** Keyword matching for extra descriptions
** Exit names for rooms
** Weapon type identification
* Use [[addstring]] and [[remove]] functions to modify the names list
* Use [[length]] function to get the number of names
* Use the '''in''' operator to check if a specific name exists in the list

== Error Handling ==
* Returns '''fail''' if unit pointer is null or invalid
* Returns '''error''' if accessed on an unsupported unit type
* Index out of bounds when accessing names.[index] will cause runtime errors
* Always validate the unit type before accessing the names field

== Related Functions/Fields ==
* [[name]] - Primary name field (first name in names list)
* [[addstring]] - Add a name to the names list
* [[remove]] - Remove a name from the names list
* [[insert]] - Insert a name at specific position
* [[length]] - Get number of names in the list
* [[substring]] - Extract part of a name string
* [[in]] - Check if name exists in the names list
